title: Firefox open udp ports
content:
firefox 88.0.1-1 on linux Since recently firefox started to open random udp ports that's what i see in netstat udp 0 0 0.0.0.0:36531 0.0.0.0:* 16227/firefox udp 0 0 0.0.0.0:43783 0.0.0.0:* 16227/firefox is that related to http3 in some way? there is nothing in about:networking

I am just not sure if this is anything to be concerned with, i did a bunch of searches for firefox open ports, but couldn't find an answer
creator: 0nrefn1

title: Connection not secure on well-known sites
content:
I have noticed that recently a lot of well-known and trusted sites(eg- youtube) are showing connection not secure (Parts of page are not secure such as images and any information that you share may be leaked -passwords etc) . Sometimes when I reload the site, it again shows connection secure.

Is this a glitch or something to be worried about and is there a solution?

Firefox Version - 88.0.1 (64-bit) OS- Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS
creator: prkandmap23

title: Trouble importing bookmarks from HTML file
content: I exported my bookmarks from the Brave Browser, selected Bookmarks>Manage Bookmarks>Import and Backup>Import Bookmarks from HTML Then navigated to the HTML file the selected "Open" but noting changed except that a small number of the bookmarks appears under "Recent Bookmarks" when I again select Bookmarks. Each item in this list is repeated according to the number of times I tried to import them.
creator: plho

title: Once I clear cache...
content: Whenever I clear the cache then when I log back into twitter or YT I have to reset to dark theme. This did not happen with Opera which I took out and replaced with FF on Windows 10 laptop. Is there a fix for this pls? Thanks so much!!
creator: astralchyld

title: Searches and Top Sites
content: Whatever I search for (using DuckDuckGo as FF is NOT private search engine) ends up on my Top Sites. I have to keep hitting Dismiss for every site I go to! Please, there must be an easy fix for this? TY!!
creator: astralchyld

title: Images within an article in Yahoo news are all blanks but the space for the image is there
content: Looking at stories in Yahoo news and the heading picture is there but any images imbedded within the story are a blank. Right clicking on that blank location where the story pictures should be does not get a "properties" notation nor anything else. It's as if it has not downloaded at all. It's easy to eliminate any anti virus protections from interfering because it happens on all of my computers. My Windows 10 computers use Firefox 64 bit 88.0.1 and one uses Norton 360 anti virus and the other uses Trend Micro anti virus. My other computers are running on Linux Mint 20.1 and Firefox 86.0.1. The fact that two different OS's display the same trouble points straight to Firefox.
creator: cavman35

title: Firefox browser opens too large
content: How can I stop my FF browser from opening larger that the screen? Thanks
creator: threeduggaduggas
